description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger. Number of lines per page varies. Written in black ink with use of red. European glazed paper with watermark. Fol. 7b-8a have a golden and black frame with an illuminated headpiece. Two pages are cut off between fol. 196 and 197. Inscriptions and ownership statements on fol. 1a. Title on the lower edge of the text block. Label pasted on the upper cover with the inscription in Arabic script "[...] 314". Label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover with the inscription in Arabic script "Ḥ 471/2". Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Text 10 ( Risālah fī ḥaqq abaway Rasūl Allāh ) was copied in 1131 H. (colophon, fol. 61a). The colophon of text 16 (ʻIddat asʼilah wa-ajwibah) adds the name of the copyist: al-Ḥājj Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥājj Ḥusayn al-Sāfirī (fol. 87b).
author: Niyazı̂, d. 1693 or 4.
abstract: Collection of texts in Arabic and Turkish, mostly on religious matters.
extent: 197 leaves : paper ; 215 x 150 (143 x 65) mm. bound to 217 x 157 mm.
title: Tasbīʻ li-Qaṣīdat al-Burdah ... [etc.].
creator: Niyazı̂, d. 1693 or 4.
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Brown and yellow marbled paper over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers and envelope flap. Red leather for spine and fore-edge flap. The same marbled paper is used for the doublure.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
